intro: Thysanocarpus curvipes subsp. elegans, commonly known as the slender thysanocarpus, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small shrub characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and opposite leaves with a distinctive elliptical shape. The flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have five petals. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of the genus. This subspecies is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
